00102 /*
00103  * Concatenate context of the temporary mount point if selinux is enabled
00104  */
00105 #ifdef HAVE_SELINUX
00106 static void append_context_for_mount(char *mntpt, struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00107 {
00108         security_context_t fcontext;
00109 
00110         if (getfilecon(mntpt, &fcontext) < 0) {
00111                 /* Continuing with default behaviour */
00112                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Get file context failed : %s\n",
00113                         progname, strerror(errno));
00114                 return;
00115         }
00116 
00117         if (fcontext != NULL) {
00118                 append_unique(mop->mo_ldd.ldd_mount_opts,
00119                               ",", "context", fcontext,
00120                               sizeof(mop->mo_ldd.ldd_mount_opts));
00121                 freecon(fcontext);
00122         }
00123 }
00124 #endif
00125 
00126 /* return canonicalized absolute pathname, even if the target file does not
00127  * exist, unlike realpath */
00128 static char *absolute_path(char *devname)
00129 {
00130         char  buf[PATH_MAX + 1] = "";
00131         char *path;
00132         char *ptr;
00133         int len;
00134 
00135         path = malloc(sizeof(buf));
00136         if (path == NULL)
00137                 return NULL;
00138 
00139         if (devname[0] != '/') {
00140                 if (getcwd(buf, sizeof(buf) - 1) == NULL) {
00141                         free(path);
00142                         return NULL;
00143                 }
00144                 len = snprintf(path, sizeof(buf), "%s/%s", buf, devname);
00145                 if (len >= sizeof(buf)) {
00146                         free(path);
00147                         return NULL;
00148                 }
00149         } else {
00150                 len = snprintf(path, sizeof(buf), "%s", devname);
00151                 if (len >= sizeof(buf)) {
00152                         free(path);
00153                         return NULL;
00154                 }
00155         }
00156 
00157         /* truncate filename before calling realpath */
00158         ptr = strrchr(path, '/');
00159         if (ptr == NULL) {
00160                 free(path);
00161                 return NULL;
00162         }
00163         *ptr = '\0';
00164         if (buf != realpath(path, buf)) {
00165                 free(path);
00166                 return NULL;
00167         }
00168         /* add the filename back */
00169         len = snprintf(path, PATH_MAX, "%s/%s", buf, ptr+1);
00170         if (len >= PATH_MAX) {
00171                 free(path);
00172                 return NULL;
00173         }
00174         return path;
00175 }
00176 
00177 /* Determine if a device is a block device (as opposed to a file) */
00178 static int is_block(char *devname)
00179 {
00180         struct stat st;
00181         int     ret = 0;
00182         char    *devpath;
00183 
00184         devpath = absolute_path(devname);
00185         if (devpath == NULL) {
00186                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: failed to resolve path to %s\n",
00187                         progname, devname);
00188                 return -1;
00189         }
00190 
00191         ret = access(devname, F_OK);
00192         if (ret != 0) {
00193                 if (strncmp(devpath, "/dev/", 5) == 0) {
00194                         /* nobody sane wants to create a loopback file under
00195                          * /dev. Let's just report the device doesn't exist */
00196                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s apparently does not exist\n",
00197                                 progname, devpath);
00198                         ret = -1;
00199                         goto out;
00200                 }
00201                 ret = 0;
00202                 goto out;
00203         }
00204         ret = stat(devpath, &st);
00205         if (ret != 0) {
00206                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot stat %s\n", progname, devpath);
00207                 goto out;
00208         }
00209         ret = S_ISBLK(st.st_mode);
00210 out:
00211         free(devpath);
00212         return ret;
00213 }
00214 
00215 static int is_feature_enabled(const char *feature, const char *devpath)
00216 {
00217         char cmd[PATH_MAX];
00218         FILE *fp;
00219         char enabled_features[4096] = "";
00220         int ret = 1;
00221 
00222         snprintf(cmd, sizeof(cmd), "%s -R features %s 2>&1",
00223                  DEBUGFS, devpath);
00224 
00225         /* Using popen() instead of run_command() since debugfs does
00226          * not return proper error code if command is not supported */
00227         fp = popen(cmd, "r");
00228         if (!fp) {
00229                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", progname, strerror(errno));
00230                 return 0;
00231         }
00232 
00233         ret = fread(enabled_features, 1, sizeof(enabled_features) - 1, fp);
00234         enabled_features[ret] = '\0';
00235         pclose(fp);
00236 
00237         if (strstr(enabled_features, feature))
00238                 return 1;
00239         return 0;
00240 }
00241 
00242 /* Write the server config files */
00243 int ldiskfs_write_ldd(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00244 {
00245         char mntpt[] = "/tmp/mntXXXXXX";
00246         char filepnm[128];
00247         char *dev;
00248         FILE *filep;
00249         int ret = 0;
00250         size_t num;
00251 
00252         /* Mount this device temporarily in order to write these files */
00253         if (!mkdtemp(mntpt)) {
00254                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Can't create temp mount point %s: %s\n",
00255                         progname, mntpt, strerror(errno));
00256                 return errno;
00257         }
00258 
00259         /*
00260          * Append file context to mount options if SE Linux is enabled
00261          */
00262         #ifdef HAVE_SELINUX
00263         if (is_selinux_enabled() > 0)
00264                 append_context_for_mount(mntpt, mop);
00265         #endif
00266 
00267         dev = mop->mo_device;
00268         if (mop->mo_flags & MO_IS_LOOP)
00269                 dev = mop->mo_loopdev;
00270 
00271         ret = mount(dev, mntpt, MT_STR(&mop->mo_ldd), 0,
00272                 (mop->mo_mountopts == NULL) ?
00273                 "errors=remount-ro" : mop->mo_mountopts);
00274         if (ret) {
00275                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to mount %s: %s\n",
00276                         progname, dev, strerror(errno));
00277                 ret = errno;
00278                 if (errno == ENODEV) {
00279                         fprintf(stderr, "Is the %s module available?\n",
00280                                 MT_STR(&mop->mo_ldd));
00281                 }
00282                 goto out_rmdir;
00283         }
00284 
00285         /* Set up initial directories */
00286         sprintf(filepnm, "%s/%s", mntpt, MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR);
00287         ret = mkdir(filepnm, 0777);
00288         if ((ret != 0) && (errno != EEXIST)) {
00289                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Can't make configs dir %s (%s)\n",
00290                         progname, filepnm, strerror(errno));
00291                 goto out_umnt;
00292         } else if (errno == EEXIST) {
00293                 ret = 0;
00294         }
00295 
00296         /* Save the persistent mount data into a file. Lustre must pre-read
00297            this file to get the real mount options. */
00298         vprint("Writing %s\n", MOUNT_DATA_FILE);
00299         sprintf(filepnm, "%s/%s", mntpt, MOUNT_DATA_FILE);
00300         filep = fopen(filepnm, "w");
00301         if (!filep) {
00302                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to create %s file: %s\n",
00303                         progname, filepnm, strerror(errno));
00304                 goto out_umnt;
00305         }
00306         num = fwrite(&mop->mo_ldd, sizeof(mop->mo_ldd), 1, filep);
00307         if (num < 1 && ferror(filep)) {
00308                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to write to file (%s): %s\n",
00309                         progname, filepnm, strerror(errno));
00310                 fclose(filep);
00311                 goto out_umnt;
00312         }
00313         fclose(filep);
00314 
00315 out_umnt:
00316         umount(mntpt);
00317 out_rmdir:
00318         rmdir(mntpt);
00319         return ret;
00320 }
00321 
00322 static int readcmd(char *cmd, char *buf, int len)
00323 {
00324         FILE *fp;
00325         int red;
00326 
00327         fp = popen(cmd, "r");
00328         if (!fp)
00329                 return errno;
00330 
00331         red = fread(buf, 1, len, fp);
00332         pclose(fp);
00333 
00334         /* strip trailing newline */
00335         if (buf[red - 1] == '\n')
00336                 buf[red - 1] = '\0';
00337 
00338         return (red == 0) ? -ENOENT : 0;
00339 }
00340 
00341 int ldiskfs_read_ldd(char *dev, struct lustre_disk_data *mo_ldd)
00342 {
00343         char tmpdir[] = "/tmp/dirXXXXXX";
00344         char cmd[PATH_MAX];
00345         char filepnm[128];
00346         FILE *filep;
00347         int ret = 0;
00348         int cmdsz = sizeof(cmd);
00349 
00350         /* Make a temporary directory to hold Lustre data files. */
00351         if (!mkdtemp(tmpdir)) {
00352                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Can't create temporary directory %s: %s\n",
00353                         progname, tmpdir, strerror(errno));
00354                 return errno;
00355         }
00356 
00357         /* TODO: it's worth observing the get_mountdata() function that is
00358            in mount_utils.c for getting the mountdata out of the
00359            filesystem */
00360 
00361         /* Construct debugfs command line. */
00362         snprintf(cmd, cmdsz, "%s -c -R 'dump /%s %s/mountdata' '%s'",
00363                  DEBUGFS, MOUNT_DATA_FILE, tmpdir, dev);
00364 
00365         ret = run_command(cmd, cmdsz);
00366         if (ret)
00367                 verrprint("%s: Unable to dump %s dir (%d)\n",
00368                           progname, MOUNT_CONFIGS_DIR, ret);
00369 
00370         sprintf(filepnm, "%s/mountdata", tmpdir);
00371         filep = fopen(filepnm, "r");
00372         if (filep) {
00373                 size_t num_read;
00374                 vprint("Reading %s\n", MOUNT_DATA_FILE);
00375                 num_read = fread(mo_ldd, sizeof(*mo_ldd), 1, filep);
00376                 if (num_read < 1 && ferror(filep)) {
00377                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to read from file %s: %s\n",
00378                                 progname, filepnm, strerror(errno));
00379                 }
00380                 fclose(filep);
00381         }
00382 
00383         snprintf(cmd, cmdsz, "rm -rf %s", tmpdir);
00384         run_command(cmd, cmdsz);
00385         if (ret)
00386                 verrprint("Failed to read old data (%d)\n", ret);
00387 
00388         /* As long as we at least have the label, we're good to go */
00389         snprintf(cmd, sizeof(cmd), E2LABEL" %s", dev);
00390         ret = readcmd(cmd, mo_ldd->ldd_svname, sizeof(mo_ldd->ldd_svname) - 1);
00391 
00392         return ret;
00393 }

00396 /* Display the need for the latest e2fsprogs to be installed. make_backfs
00397  * indicates if the caller is make_lustre_backfs() or not. */
00398 static void disp_old_e2fsprogs_msg(const char *feature, int make_backfs)
00399 {
00400         static int msg_displayed;
00401 
00402         if (msg_displayed) {
00403                 fprintf(stderr, "WARNING: %s does not support %s "
00404                         "feature.\n\n", E2FSPROGS, feature);
00405                 return;
00406         }
00407 
00408         msg_displayed++;
00409 
00410         fprintf(stderr, "WARNING: The %s package currently installed on "
00411                 "your system does not support \"%s\" feature.\n",
00412                 E2FSPROGS, feature);
00413 #if !(HAVE_LDISKFSPROGS)
00414         fprintf(stderr, "Please install the latest version of e2fsprogs from\n"
00415                 "https://downloads.hpdd.intel.com/public/e2fsprogs/latest/\n"
00416                 "to enable this feature.\n");
00417 #endif
00418         if (make_backfs)
00419                 fprintf(stderr, "Feature will not be enabled until %s"
00420                         "is updated and '%s -O %s %%{device}' "
00421                         "is run.\n\n", E2FSPROGS, TUNE2FS, feature);
00422 }
00423 
00424 /* Check whether the file exists in the device */
00425 static int file_in_dev(char *file_name, char *dev_name)
00426 {
00427         FILE *fp;
00428         char debugfs_cmd[256];
00429         unsigned int inode_num;
00430         int i;
00431 
00432         /* Construct debugfs command line. */
00433         snprintf(debugfs_cmd, sizeof(debugfs_cmd),
00434                  "%s -c -R 'stat %s' '%s' 2>&1 | egrep '(Inode|unsupported)'",
00435                  DEBUGFS, file_name, dev_name);
00436 
00437         fp = popen(debugfs_cmd, "r");
00438         if (!fp) {
00439                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", progname, strerror(errno));
00440                 return 0;
00441         }
00442 
00443         if (fscanf(fp, "Inode: %u", &inode_num) == 1) { /* exist */
00444                 pclose(fp);
00445                 return 1;
00446         }
00447         i = fread(debugfs_cmd, 1, sizeof(debugfs_cmd) - 1, fp);
00448         if (i) {
00449                 debugfs_cmd[i] = 0;
00450                 fprintf(stderr, "%s", debugfs_cmd);
00451                 if (strstr(debugfs_cmd, "unsupported feature")) {
00452                         disp_old_e2fsprogs_msg("an unknown", 0);
00453                 }
00454                 pclose(fp);
00455                 return -1;
00456         }
00457         pclose(fp);
00458         return 0;
00459 }
00460 
00461 /* Check whether the device has already been used with lustre */
00462 int ldiskfs_is_lustre(char *dev, unsigned *mount_type)
00463 {
00464         int ret;
00465 
00466         ret = file_in_dev(MOUNT_DATA_FILE, dev);
00467         if (ret) {
00468                 /* in the -1 case, 'extents' means IS a lustre target */
00469                 *mount_type = LDD_MT_LDISKFS;
00470                 return 1;
00471         }
00472 
00473         ret = file_in_dev(LAST_RCVD, dev);
00474         if (ret) {
00475                 *mount_type = LDD_MT_LDISKFS;
00476                 return 1;
00477         }
00478 
00479         return 0;
00480 }
00481 
00482 /* Check if a certain feature is supported by e2fsprogs.
00483  * Firstly we try to use "debugfs supported_features" command to check if
00484  * the feature is supported. If this fails we try to set this feature with
00485  * mke2fs to check for its support. */
00486 static int is_e2fsprogs_feature_supp(const char *feature)
00487 {
00488         static char supp_features[4096] = "";
00489         FILE *fp;
00490         char cmd[PATH_MAX];
00491         char imgname[] = "/tmp/test-img-XXXXXX";
00492         int fd = -1;
00493         int ret = 1;
00494 
00495         if (supp_features[0] == '\0') {
00496                 snprintf(cmd, sizeof(cmd), "%s -c -R supported_features 2>&1",
00497                          DEBUGFS);
00498 
00499                 /* Using popen() instead of run_command() since debugfs does
00500                  * not return proper error code if command is not supported */
00501                 fp = popen(cmd, "r");
00502                 if (!fp) {
00503                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", progname, strerror(errno));
00504                         return 0;
00505                 }
00506                 ret = fread(supp_features, 1, sizeof(supp_features) - 1, fp);
00507                 supp_features[ret] = '\0';
00508                 pclose(fp);
00509         }
00510         if (ret > 0 && strstr(supp_features,
00511                               strncmp(feature, "-O ", 3) ? feature : feature+3))
00512                 return 0;
00513 
00514         if ((fd = mkstemp(imgname)) < 0)
00515                 return -1;
00516         else
00517                 close(fd);
00518 
00519         snprintf(cmd, sizeof(cmd), "%s -F %s %s 100 >/dev/null 2>&1",
00520                  MKE2FS, feature, imgname);
00521         /* run_command() displays the output of mke2fs when it fails for
00522          * some feature, so use system() directly */
00523         ret = system(cmd);
00524         unlink(imgname);
00525 
00526         return ret;
00527 }
00528 
00529 
00538 static void append_unique(char *buf, char *prefix, char *key, char *val,
00539                           size_t maxbuflen)
00540 {
00541         char *anchor, *end;
00542         int  len;
00543 
00544         if (key == NULL)
00545                 return;
00546 
00547         anchor = end = strstr(buf, key);
00548         /* try to find exact match string in @buf */
00549         while (end && *end != '\0' && *end != ',' && *end != ' ' && *end != '=')
00550                 ++end;
00551         len = end - anchor;
00552         if (anchor == NULL || strlen(key) != len ||
00553                         strncmp(anchor, key, len) != 0) {
00554                 if (prefix != NULL)
00555                         strscat(buf, prefix, maxbuflen);
00556 
00557                 strscat(buf, key, maxbuflen);
00558                 if (val != NULL) {
00559                         strscat(buf, "=\"", maxbuflen);
00560                         strscat(buf, val, maxbuflen);
00561                         strscat(buf, "\"", maxbuflen);
00562                 }
00563         }
00564 }
00565 
00566 static int enable_default_ext4_features(struct mkfs_opts *mop, char *anchor,
00567                                         size_t maxbuflen, int user_spec)
00568 {
00569         if (IS_OST(&mop->mo_ldd)) {
00570                 append_unique(anchor, user_spec ? "," : " -O ",
00571                               "extents", NULL, maxbuflen);
00572                 append_unique(anchor, ",", "uninit_bg", NULL, maxbuflen);
00573         } else if (IS_MDT(&mop->mo_ldd)) {
00574                 append_unique(anchor, user_spec ? "," : " -O ",
00575                               "dirdata", NULL, maxbuflen);
00576                 append_unique(anchor, ",", "uninit_bg", NULL, maxbuflen);
00577                 append_unique(anchor, ",", "^extents", NULL, maxbuflen);
00578         } else {
00579                 append_unique(anchor, user_spec ? "," : " -O ",
00580                               "uninit_bg", NULL, maxbuflen);
00581         }
00582 
00583         /* Multiple mount protection enabled only if failover node specified */
00584         if (mop->mo_flags & MO_FAILOVER) {
00585                 if (is_e2fsprogs_feature_supp("-O mmp") == 0)
00586                         append_unique(anchor, ",", "mmp", NULL, maxbuflen);
00587                 else
00588                         disp_old_e2fsprogs_msg("mmp", 1);
00589         }
00590 
00591         /* Allow more than 65000 subdirectories */
00592         if (is_e2fsprogs_feature_supp("-O dir_nlink") == 0)
00593                 append_unique(anchor, ",", "dir_nlink", NULL, maxbuflen);
00594 
00595         /* The following options are only valid for ext4-based ldiskfs.
00596          * If --backfstype=ext3 is specified, do not enable them. */
00597         if (mop->mo_ldd.ldd_mount_type == LDD_MT_EXT3)
00598                 return 0;
00599 
00600         /* Enable quota by default */
00601         if (is_e2fsprogs_feature_supp("-O quota") == 0) {
00602                 append_unique(anchor, ",", "quota", NULL, maxbuflen);
00603         } else {
00604                 fatal();
00605                 fprintf(stderr, "\"-O quota\" must be supported by "
00606                         "e2fsprogs, please upgrade your e2fsprogs.\n");
00607                 return EINVAL;
00608         }
00609 
00610         /* Allow files larger than 2TB.  Also needs LU-16, but not harmful. */
00611         if (is_e2fsprogs_feature_supp("-O huge_file") == 0)
00612                 append_unique(anchor, ",", "huge_file", NULL, maxbuflen);
00613 
00614         /* Enable large block addresses if the LUN is over 2^32 blocks. */
00615         if (mop->mo_device_kb / (L_BLOCK_SIZE >> 10) >= 0x100002000ULL &&
00616             is_e2fsprogs_feature_supp("-O 64bit") == 0)
00617                 append_unique(anchor, ",", "64bit", NULL, maxbuflen);
00618 
00619         /* Cluster inode/block bitmaps and inode table for more efficient IO.
00620          * Align the flex groups on a 1MB boundary for better performance. */
00621         /* This -O feature needs to go last, since it adds the "-G" option. */
00622         if (is_e2fsprogs_feature_supp("-O flex_bg") == 0) {
00623                 char tmp_buf[64];
00624 
00625                 append_unique(anchor, ",", "flex_bg", NULL, maxbuflen);
00626 
00627                 if (IS_OST(&mop->mo_ldd) &&
00628                     strstr(mop->mo_mkfsopts, "-G") == NULL) {
00629                         snprintf(tmp_buf, sizeof(tmp_buf), " -G %u",
00630                                  (1 << 20) / L_BLOCK_SIZE);
00631                         strscat(anchor, tmp_buf, maxbuflen);
00632                 }
00633         }
00634         /* Don't add any more "-O" options here, see last comment above */
00635         return 0;
00636 }
00637 
00645 static char *moveopts_to_end(char *start)
00646 {
00647         size_t len;
00648         char save[512];
00649         char *end, *idx;
00650 
00651         /* skip whitespace before options */
00652         end = start + 2;
00653         while (*end == ' ')
00654                 ++end;
00655 
00656         /* find end of option characters */
00657         while (*end != ' ' && *end != '\0')
00658                 ++end;
00659 
00660         len = end - start;
00661         if (len >= sizeof(save))
00662                 len = sizeof(save) - 1;
00663 
00664         /* save options */
00665         strncpy(save, start, len);
00666         save[len] = '\0';
00667 
00668         /* move remaining options up front */
00669         if (*end)
00670                 memmove(start, end, strlen(end));
00671         *(start + strlen(end)) = '\0';
00672 
00673         /* append the specified options */
00674         if (*(start + strlen(start) - 1) != ' ')
00675                 strcat(start, " ");
00676         idx = start + strlen(start);
00677         strcat(start, save);
00678 
00679         return idx;
00680 }
00681 
00682 /* Build fs according to type */
00683 int ldiskfs_make_lustre(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00684 {
00685         __u64 device_kb = mop->mo_device_kb, block_count = 0;
00686         char mkfs_cmd[PATH_MAX];
00687         char buf[64];
00688         char *start;
00689         char *dev;
00690         int ret = 0, ext_opts = 0;
00691         size_t maxbuflen;
00692 
00693         if (!(mop->mo_flags & MO_IS_LOOP)) {
00694                 mop->mo_device_kb = get_device_size(mop->mo_device);
00695 
00696                 if (mop->mo_device_kb == 0)
00697                         return ENODEV;
00698 
00699                 /* Compare to real size */
00700                 if (device_kb == 0 || device_kb > mop->mo_device_kb)
00701                         device_kb = mop->mo_device_kb;
00702                 else
00703                         mop->mo_device_kb = device_kb;
00704         }
00705 
00706         if (mop->mo_device_kb != 0) {
00707                 if (mop->mo_device_kb < 32384) {
00708                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: size of filesystem must be larger "
00709                                 "than 32MB, but is set to %lldKB\n",
00710                                 progname, (long long)mop->mo_device_kb);
00711                         return EINVAL;
00712                 }
00713                 block_count = mop->mo_device_kb / (L_BLOCK_SIZE >> 10);
00714                 /* If the LUN size is just over 2^32 blocks, limit the
00715                  * filesystem size to 2^32-1 blocks to avoid problems with
00716                  * ldiskfs/mkfs not handling this size.  Bug 22906 */
00717                 if (block_count > 0xffffffffULL && block_count < 0x100002000ULL)
00718                         block_count = 0xffffffffULL;
00719         }
00720 
00721         if ((mop->mo_ldd.ldd_mount_type == LDD_MT_EXT3) ||
00722             (mop->mo_ldd.ldd_mount_type == LDD_MT_LDISKFS) ||
00723             (mop->mo_ldd.ldd_mount_type == LDD_MT_LDISKFS2)) {
00724                 long inode_size = 0;
00725 
00726                 /* Journal size in MB */
00727                 if (strstr(mop->mo_mkfsopts, "-J") == NULL &&
00728                     device_kb > 1024 * 1024) {
00729                         /* Choose our own default journal size */
00730                         long journal_mb = 0, max_mb;
00731 
00732                         /* cap journal size at 4GB for MDT,
00733                          * leave it at 400MB for OSTs. */
00734                         if (IS_MDT(&mop->mo_ldd))
00735                                 max_mb = 4096;
00736                         else if (IS_OST(&mop->mo_ldd))
00737                                 max_mb = 400;
00738                         else /* Use mke2fs default size for MGS */
00739                                 max_mb = 0;
00740 
00741                         /* Use at most 4% of device for journal */
00742                         journal_mb = device_kb * 4 / (1024 * 100);
00743                         if (journal_mb > max_mb)
00744                                 journal_mb = max_mb;
00745 
00746                         if (journal_mb) {
00747                                 sprintf(buf, " -J size=%ld", journal_mb);
00748                                 strscat(mop->mo_mkfsopts, buf,
00749                                         sizeof(mop->mo_mkfsopts));
00750                         }
00751                 }
00752 
00753                 /* Inode size includes:
00754                  *   ldiskfs inode size: 156
00755                  *   extended attributes size, including:
00756                  *      ext4_xattr_header: 32
00757                  *      LOV EA size: 32(lov_mds_md) +
00758                  *                   stripes * 24(lov_ost_data) +
00759                  *                   16(xattr_entry) + 3(lov)
00760                  *      LMA EA size: 24(lustre_mdt_attrs) +
00761                  *                   16(xattr_entry) + 3(lma)
00762                  *      link EA size: 24(link_ea_header) + 18(link_ea_entry) +
00763                  *                    (filename) + 16(xattr_entry) + 4(link)
00764                  *   and some margin for 4-byte alignment, ACLs and other EAs.
00765                  *
00766                  * If we say the average filename length is about 32 bytes,
00767                  * the calculation looks like:
00768                  * 156 + 32 + (32+24*N+19) + (24+19) + (24+18+~32+20) + other <=
00769                  * 512*2^m, {m=0,1,2,3}
00770                  */
00771                 if (strstr(mop->mo_mkfsopts, "-I") == NULL) {
00772                         if (IS_MDT(&mop->mo_ldd)) {
00773                                 if (mop->mo_stripe_count > 69)
00774                                         inode_size = 512; /* bz 7241 */
00775                                 /* see also "-i" below for EA blocks */
00776                                 else if (mop->mo_stripe_count > 26)
00777                                         inode_size = 2048;
00778                                 else if (mop->mo_stripe_count > 5)
00779                                         inode_size = 1024;
00780                                 else
00781                                         inode_size = 512;
00782                         } else if (IS_OST(&mop->mo_ldd)) {
00783                                 /* We store MDS FID and OST objid in EA on OST
00784                                  * we need to make inode bigger as well. */
00785                                 inode_size = 256;
00786                         }
00787 
00788                         if (inode_size > 0) {
00789                                 sprintf(buf, " -I %ld", inode_size);
00790                                 strscat(mop->mo_mkfsopts, buf,
00791                                         sizeof(mop->mo_mkfsopts));
00792                         }
00793                 }
00794 
00795                 /* Bytes_per_inode: disk size / num inodes */
00796                 if (strstr(mop->mo_mkfsopts, "-i") == NULL &&
00797                     strstr(mop->mo_mkfsopts, "-N") == NULL) {
00798                         long bytes_per_inode = 0;
00799 
00800                         /* Allocate more inodes on MDT devices.  There is
00801                          * no data stored on the MDT, and very little extra
00802                          * metadata beyond the inode.  It could go down as
00803                          * low as 1024 bytes, but this is conservative.
00804                          * Account for external EA blocks for wide striping. */
00805                         if (IS_MDT(&mop->mo_ldd)) {
00806                                 bytes_per_inode = inode_size + 1536;
00807 
00808                                 if (mop->mo_stripe_count > 69) {
00809                                         int extra = mop->mo_stripe_count * 24;
00810                                         extra = ((extra - 1) | 4095) + 1;
00811                                         bytes_per_inode += extra;
00812                                 }
00813                         }
00814 
00815                         /* Allocate fewer inodes on large OST devices.  Most
00816                          * filesystems can be much more aggressive than even
00817                          * this, but it is impossible to know in advance. */
00818                         if (IS_OST(&mop->mo_ldd)) {
00819                                 /* OST > 16TB assume average file size 1MB */
00820                                 if (device_kb > (16ULL << 30))
00821                                         bytes_per_inode = 1024 * 1024;
00822                                 /* OST > 4TB assume average file size 512kB */
00823                                 else if (device_kb > (4ULL << 30))
00824                                         bytes_per_inode = 512 * 1024;
00825                                 /* OST > 1TB assume average file size 256kB */
00826                                 else if (device_kb > (1ULL << 30))
00827                                         bytes_per_inode = 256 * 1024;
00828                                 /* OST > 10GB assume average file size 64kB,
00829                                  * plus a bit so that inodes will fit into a
00830                                  * 256x flex_bg without overflowing */
00831                                 else if (device_kb > (10ULL << 20))
00832                                         bytes_per_inode = 69905;
00833                         }
00834 
00835                         if (bytes_per_inode > 0) {
00836                                 sprintf(buf, " -i %ld", bytes_per_inode);
00837                                 strscat(mop->mo_mkfsopts, buf,
00838                                         sizeof(mop->mo_mkfsopts));
00839                         }
00840                 }
00841 
00842                 if (verbose < 2) {
00843                         strscat(mop->mo_mkfsopts, " -q",
00844                                 sizeof(mop->mo_mkfsopts));
00845                 }
00846 
00847                 /* start handle -O mkfs options */
00848                 if ((start = strstr(mop->mo_mkfsopts, "-O")) != NULL) {
00849                         if (strstr(start + 2, "-O") != NULL) {
00850                                 fprintf(stderr,
00851                                         "%s: don't specify multiple -O options\n",
00852                                         progname);
00853                                 return EINVAL;
00854                         }
00855                         start = moveopts_to_end(start);
00856                         maxbuflen = sizeof(mop->mo_mkfsopts) -
00857                                 (start - mop->mo_mkfsopts) - strlen(start);
00858                         ret = enable_default_ext4_features(mop, start, maxbuflen, 1);
00859                 } else {
00860                         start = mop->mo_mkfsopts + strlen(mop->mo_mkfsopts),
00861                               maxbuflen = sizeof(mop->mo_mkfsopts) -
00862                                       strlen(mop->mo_mkfsopts);
00863                         ret = enable_default_ext4_features(mop, start, maxbuflen, 0);
00864                 }
00865                 if (ret)
00866                         return ret;
00867                 /* end handle -O mkfs options */
00868 
00869                 /* start handle -E mkfs options */
00870                 if ((start = strstr(mop->mo_mkfsopts, "-E")) != NULL) {
00871                         if (strstr(start + 2, "-E") != NULL) {
00872                                 fprintf(stderr,
00873                                         "%s: don't specify multiple -E options\n",
00874                                         progname);
00875                                 return EINVAL;
00876                         }
00877                         start = moveopts_to_end(start);
00878                         maxbuflen = sizeof(mop->mo_mkfsopts) -
00879                                 (start - mop->mo_mkfsopts) - strlen(start);
00880                         ext_opts = 1;
00881                 } else {
00882                         start = mop->mo_mkfsopts + strlen(mop->mo_mkfsopts);
00883                         maxbuflen = sizeof(mop->mo_mkfsopts) -
00884                                 strlen(mop->mo_mkfsopts);
00885                 }
00886 
00887                 /* In order to align the filesystem metadata on 1MB boundaries,
00888                  * give a resize value that will reserve a power-of-two group
00889                  * descriptor blocks, but leave one block for the superblock.
00890                  * Only useful for filesystems with < 2^32 blocks due to resize
00891                  * limitations. */
00892                 if (IS_OST(&mop->mo_ldd) && mop->mo_device_kb > 100 * 1024 &&
00893                     mop->mo_device_kb * 1024 / L_BLOCK_SIZE <= 0xffffffffULL) {
00894                         unsigned group_blocks = L_BLOCK_SIZE * 8;
00895                         unsigned desc_per_block = L_BLOCK_SIZE / 32;
00896                         unsigned resize_blks;
00897 
00898                         resize_blks = (1ULL<<32) - desc_per_block*group_blocks;
00899                         snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%u", resize_blks);
00900                         append_unique(start, ext_opts ? "," : " -E ",
00901                                       "resize", buf, maxbuflen);
00902                         ext_opts = 1;
00903                 }
00904 
00905                 /* Avoid zeroing out the full journal - speeds up mkfs */
00906                 if (is_e2fsprogs_feature_supp("-E lazy_journal_init") == 0)
00907                         append_unique(start, ext_opts ? "," : " -E ",
00908                                       "lazy_journal_init", NULL, maxbuflen);
00909                 /* end handle -E mkfs options */
00910 
00911                 /* Allow reformat of full devices (as opposed to
00912                    partitions.)  We already checked for mounted dev. */
00913                 strscat(mop->mo_mkfsopts, " -F", sizeof(mop->mo_mkfsopts));
00914 
00915                 snprintf(mkfs_cmd, sizeof(mkfs_cmd),
00916                          "%s -j -b %d -L %s ", MKE2FS, L_BLOCK_SIZE,
00917                          mop->mo_ldd.ldd_svname);
00918         } else {
00919                 fprintf(stderr,"%s: unsupported fs type: %d (%s)\n",
00920                         progname, mop->mo_ldd.ldd_mount_type,
00921                         MT_STR(&mop->mo_ldd));
00922                 return EINVAL;
00923         }
00924 
00925         /* For loop device format the dev, not the filename */
00926         dev = mop->mo_device;
00927         if (mop->mo_flags & MO_IS_LOOP)
00928                 dev = mop->mo_loopdev;
00929 
00930         vprint("formatting backing filesystem %s on %s\n",
00931                MT_STR(&mop->mo_ldd), dev);
00932         vprint("\ttarget name   %s\n", mop->mo_ldd.ldd_svname);
00933         vprint("\t4k blocks     %ju\n", (uintmax_t)block_count);
00934         vprint("\toptions       %s\n", mop->mo_mkfsopts);
00935 
00936         /* mkfs_cmd's trailing space is important! */
00937         strscat(mkfs_cmd, mop->mo_mkfsopts, sizeof(mkfs_cmd));
00938         strscat(mkfs_cmd, " ", sizeof(mkfs_cmd));
00939         strscat(mkfs_cmd, dev, sizeof(mkfs_cmd));
00940         if (block_count != 0) {
00941                 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), " %ju",
00942                          (uintmax_t)block_count);
00943                 strscat(mkfs_cmd, buf, sizeof(mkfs_cmd));
00944         }
00945 
00946         vprint("mkfs_cmd = %s\n", mkfs_cmd);
00947         ret = run_command(mkfs_cmd, sizeof(mkfs_cmd));
00948         if (ret) {
00949                 fatal();
00950                 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to build fs %s (%d)\n", dev, ret);
00951         }
00952         return ret;
00953 }
00954 
00955 int ldiskfs_prepare_lustre(struct mkfs_opts *mop,
00956                            char *wanted_mountopts, size_t len)
00957 {
00958         struct lustre_disk_data *ldd = &mop->mo_ldd;
00959         int ret;
00960 
00961         /* Set MO_IS_LOOP to indicate a loopback device is needed */
00962         ret = is_block(mop->mo_device);
00963         if (ret < 0) {
00964                 return errno;
00965         } else if (ret == 0) {
00966                 mop->mo_flags |= MO_IS_LOOP;
00967         }
00968 
00969         if (IS_MDT(ldd) || IS_MGS(ldd))
00970                 strscat(wanted_mountopts, ",user_xattr", len);
00971 
00972         return 0;
00973 }
00974 
00975 int ldiskfs_fix_mountopts(struct mkfs_opts *mop, char *mountopts, size_t len)
00976 {
00977         if (strstr(mountopts, "errors=") == NULL)
00978                 strscat(mountopts, ",errors=remount-ro", len);
00979 
00980         return 0;
00981 }
00982 
00983 static int read_file(const char *path, char *buf, int size)
00984 {
00985         FILE *fd;
00986 
00987         fd = fopen(path, "r");
00988         if (fd == NULL)
00989                 return errno;
00990 
00991         if (fgets(buf, size, fd) == NULL) {
00992                 fprintf(stderr, "reading from %s: %s", path, strerror(errno));
00993                 fclose(fd);
00994                 return 1;
00995         }
00996         fclose(fd);
00997 
00998         /* strip trailing newline */
00999         size = strlen(buf);
01000         if (buf[size - 1] == '\n')
01001                 buf[size - 1] = '\0';
01002 
01003         return 0;
01004 }
01005 
01006 static int write_file(const char *path, const char *buf)
01007 {
01008         int fd, rc;
01009 
01010         fd = open(path, O_WRONLY);
01011         if (fd < 0)
01012                 return errno;
01013 
01014         rc = write(fd, buf, strlen(buf));
01015         close(fd);
01016 
01017         return rc < 0 ? errno : 0;
01018 }
01019 
01020 static int set_blockdev_scheduler(const char *path, const char *scheduler)
01021 {
01022         char buf[PATH_MAX], *s, *e, orig_sched[50];
01023         int rc;
01024 
01025         /* Before setting the scheduler, we need to check to see if it's
01026          * already set to "noop". If it is, we don't want to override
01027          * that setting. If it's set to anything other than "noop", set
01028          * the scheduler to what has been passed in. */
01029 
01030         rc = read_file(path, buf, sizeof(buf));
01031         if (rc) {
01032                 if (verbose)
01033                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot open '%s': %s\n",
01034                                 progname, path, strerror(errno));
01035                 return rc;
01036         }
01037 
01038         /* The expected format of buf: noop anticipatory deadline [cfq] */
01039         s = strchr(buf, '[');
01040         e = strchr(buf, ']');
01041 
01042         /* If the format is not what we expect. Play it safe and error out. */
01043         if (s == NULL || e == NULL) {
01044                 if (verbose)
01045                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot parse scheduler "
01046                                         "options for '%s'\n", progname, path);
01047                 return -EINVAL;
01048         }
01049 
01050         snprintf(orig_sched, e - s, "%s", s + 1);
01051 
01052         if (strcmp(orig_sched, "noop") == 0 ||
01053             strcmp(orig_sched, scheduler) == 0)
01054                 return 0;
01055 
01056         rc = write_file(path, scheduler);
01057         if (rc) {
01058                 if (verbose)
01059                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot set scheduler on "
01060                                         "'%s': %s\n", progname, path,
01061                                         strerror(errno));
01062                 return rc;
01063         } else {
01064                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: change scheduler of %s from %s to %s\n",
01065                         progname, path, orig_sched, scheduler);
01066         }
01067 
01068         return rc;
01069 }
01070 
01071 /* This is to tune the kernel for good SCSI performance.
01072  * For that we set the value of /sys/block/{dev}/queue/max_sectors_kb
01073  * to the value of /sys/block/{dev}/queue/max_hw_sectors_kb */
01074 static int set_blockdev_tunables(char *source, struct mount_opts *mop)
01075 {
01076         glob_t glob_info = { 0 };
01077         struct stat stat_buf;
01078         char *chk_major, *chk_minor;
01079         char *savept = NULL, *dev;
01080         char *ret_path;
01081         char buf[PATH_MAX] = {'\0'}, path[PATH_MAX] = {'\0'};
01082         char real_path[PATH_MAX] = {'\0'};
01083         int i, rc = 0;
01084         int major, minor;
01085         char *slave = NULL;
01086 
01087         if (!source)
01088                 return -EINVAL;
01089 
01090         ret_path = realpath(source, real_path);
01091         if (ret_path == NULL) {
01092                 if (verbose)
01093                         fprintf(stderr, "warning: %s: cannot resolve: %s\n",
01094                                 source, strerror(errno));
01095                 return -EINVAL;
01096         }
01097 
01098         if (strncmp(real_path, "/dev/loop", 9) == 0)
01099                 return 0;
01100 
01101         if ((real_path[0] != '/') && (strpbrk(real_path, ",:") != NULL))
01102                 return 0;
01103 
01104         snprintf(path, sizeof(path), "/sys/block%s", real_path + 4);
01105         if (access(path, X_OK) == 0)
01106                 goto set_params;
01107 
01108         /* The name of the device say 'X' specified in /dev/X may not
01109          * match any entry under /sys/block/. In that case we need to
01110          * match the major/minor number to find the entry under
01111          * sys/block corresponding to /dev/X */
01112 
01113         /* Don't chop tail digit on /dev/mapper/xxx, LU-478 */
01114         if (strncmp(real_path, "/dev/mapper", 11) != 0) {
01115                 dev = real_path + strlen(real_path);
01116                 while (--dev > real_path && isdigit(*dev))
01117                         *dev = 0;
01118 
01119                 if (strncmp(real_path, "/dev/md_", 8) == 0)
01120                         *dev = 0;
01121         }
01122 
01123         rc = stat(real_path, &stat_buf);
01124         if (rc) {
01125                 if (verbose)
01126                         fprintf(stderr, "warning: %s, device %s stat failed\n",
01127                                 strerror(errno), real_path);
01128                 return rc;
01129         }
01130 
01131         major = major(stat_buf.st_rdev);
01132         minor = minor(stat_buf.st_rdev);
01133         rc = glob("/sys/block/*", GLOB_NOSORT, NULL, &glob_info);
01134         if (rc) {
01135                 if (verbose)
01136                         fprintf(stderr, "warning: failed to read entries under "
01137                                 "/sys/block\n");
01138                 globfree(&glob_info);
01139                 return rc;
01140         }
01141 
01142         for (i = 0; i < glob_info.gl_pathc; i++){
01143                 snprintf(path, sizeof(path), "%s/dev", glob_info.gl_pathv[i]);
01144 
01145                 rc = read_file(path, buf, sizeof(buf));
01146                 if (rc)
01147                         continue;
01148 
01149                 if (buf[strlen(buf) - 1] == '\n')
01150                         buf[strlen(buf) - 1] = '\0';
01151 
01152                 chk_major = strtok_r(buf, ":", &savept);
01153                 chk_minor = savept;
01154                 if (chk_major != NULL && major == atoi(chk_major) &&
01155                     chk_minor != NULL && minor == atoi(chk_minor))
01156                         break;
01157         }
01158 
01159         if (i == glob_info.gl_pathc) {
01160                 if (verbose)
01161                         fprintf(stderr,"warning: device %s does not match any "
01162                                 "entry under /sys/block\n", real_path);
01163                 globfree(&glob_info);
01164                 return -EINVAL;
01165         }
01166 
01167         /* Chop off "/dev" from path we found */
01168         path[strlen(glob_info.gl_pathv[i])] = '\0';
01169         globfree(&glob_info);
01170 
01171 set_params:
01172         if (strncmp(real_path, "/dev/md", 7) == 0) {
01173                 snprintf(real_path, sizeof(real_path), "%s/%s", path,
01174                          STRIPE_CACHE_SIZE);
01175 
01176                 rc = read_file(real_path, buf, sizeof(buf));
01177                 if (rc) {
01178                         if (verbose)
01179                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: opening %s: %s\n",
01180                                         real_path, strerror(errno));
01181                         return 0;
01182                 }
01183 
01184                 if (atoi(buf) >= mop->mo_md_stripe_cache_size)
01185                         return 0;
01186 
01187                 if (strlen(buf) - 1 > 0) {
01188                         snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%d",
01189                                  mop->mo_md_stripe_cache_size);
01190                         rc = write_file(real_path, buf);
01191                         if (rc != 0 && verbose)
01192                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: opening %s: %s\n",
01193                                         real_path, strerror(errno));
01194                 }
01195                 /* Return since raid and disk tunables are different */
01196                 return rc;
01197         }
01198 
01199         snprintf(real_path, sizeof(real_path), "%s/%s", path,
01200                  MAX_HW_SECTORS_KB_PATH);
01201         rc = read_file(real_path, buf, sizeof(buf));
01202         if (rc) {
01203                 if (verbose)
01204                         fprintf(stderr, "warning: opening %s: %s\n",
01205                                 real_path, strerror(errno));
01206                 /* No MAX_HW_SECTORS_KB_PATH isn't necessary an
01207                  * error for some device. */
01208                 goto subdevs;
01209         }
01210 
01211         if (strlen(buf) - 1 > 0) {
01212                 char oldbuf[32] = "", *end = NULL;
01213                 unsigned long long oldval, newval;
01214 
01215                 snprintf(real_path, sizeof(real_path), "%s/%s", path,
01216                          MAX_SECTORS_KB_PATH);
01217                 rc = read_file(real_path, oldbuf, sizeof(oldbuf));
01218                 /* Only set new parameter if different from the old one. */
01219                 if (rc != 0 || strcmp(oldbuf, buf) == 0) {
01220                         /* No MAX_SECTORS_KB_PATH isn't necessary an
01221                          * error for some device. */
01222                         goto subdevs;
01223                 }
01224 
01225                 newval = strtoull(buf, &end, 0);
01226                 if (newval == 0 || newval == ULLONG_MAX || end == buf)
01227                         goto subdevs;
01228 
01229                 /* Don't increase IO request size limit past 16MB.  It is about
01230                  * PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_SIZE, but that isn't in a public header.
01231                  * Note that even though the block layer allows larger values,
01232                  * setting max_sectors_kb = 32768 causes crashes (LU-6974). */
01233                 if (newval > 16 * 1024) {
01234                         newval = 16 * 1024;
01235                         snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%llu", newval);
01236                 }
01237 
01238                 oldval = strtoull(oldbuf, &end, 0);
01239                 /* Don't shrink the current limit. */
01240                 if (oldval != ULLONG_MAX && newval <= oldval)
01241                         goto subdevs;
01242 
01243                 rc = write_file(real_path, buf);
01244                 if (rc != 0) {
01245                         if (verbose)
01246                                 fprintf(stderr, "warning: writing to %s: %s\n",
01247                                         real_path, strerror(errno));
01248                         /* No MAX_SECTORS_KB_PATH isn't necessary an
01249                          * error for some device. */
01250                         goto subdevs;
01251                 }
01252                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: increased %s from %s to %s\n",
01253                         progname, real_path, oldbuf, buf);
01254         }
01255 
01256 subdevs:
01257         /* Purposely ignore errors reported from set_blockdev_scheduler.
01258          * The worst that will happen is a block device with an "incorrect"
01259          * scheduler. */
01260         snprintf(real_path, sizeof(real_path), "%s/%s", path, SCHEDULER_PATH);
01261         set_blockdev_scheduler(real_path, DEFAULT_SCHEDULER);
01262 
01263         /* if device is multipath device, tune its slave devices */
01264         glob_info.gl_pathc = 0;
01265         glob_info.gl_offs = 0;
01266         snprintf(real_path, sizeof(real_path), "%s/slaves/*", path);
01267         rc = glob(real_path, GLOB_NOSORT, NULL, &glob_info);
01268 
01269         for (i = 0; rc == 0 && i < glob_info.gl_pathc; i++) {
01270                 slave = basename(glob_info.gl_pathv[i]);
01271                 snprintf(real_path, sizeof(real_path), "/dev/%s", slave);
01272                 rc = set_blockdev_tunables(real_path, mop);
01273         }
01274 
01275         if (rc == GLOB_NOMATCH) {
01276                 /* no slave device is not an error */
01277                 rc = 0;
01278         } else if (rc && verbose) {
01279                 if (slave == NULL) {
01280                         fprintf(stderr, "warning: %s, failed to read"
01281                                 " entries under %s/slaves\n",
01282                                 strerror(errno), path);
01283                 } else {
01284                         fprintf(stderr, "unable to set tunables for"
01285                                 " slave device %s (slave would be"
01286                                 " unable to handle IO request from"
01287                                 " master %s)\n",
01288                                 real_path, source);
01289                 }
01290         }
01291         globfree(&glob_info);
01292 
01293         return rc;
01294 }
01295 
01296 int ldiskfs_tune_lustre(char *dev, struct mount_opts *mop)
01297 {
01298         return set_blockdev_tunables(dev, mop);
01299 }
01300 
01301 int ldiskfs_label_lustre(struct mount_opts *mop)
01302 {
01303         char label_cmd[PATH_MAX];
01304         int rc;
01305 
01306         snprintf(label_cmd, sizeof(label_cmd),
01307                  TUNE2FS" -f -L '%s' '%s' >/dev/null 2>&1",
01308                  mop->mo_ldd.ldd_svname, mop->mo_source);
01309         rc = run_command(label_cmd, sizeof(label_cmd));
01310 
01311         return rc;
01312 }
01313 
01314 /* Enable quota accounting */
01315 int ldiskfs_enable_quota(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
01316 {
01317         char *dev;
01318         char cmd[512];
01319         int cmdsz = sizeof(cmd), ret;
01320 
01321         if (is_e2fsprogs_feature_supp("-O quota") != 0) {
01322                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: \"-O quota\" is is not supported by "
01323                         "current e2fsprogs\n", progname);
01324                 return EINVAL;
01325         }
01326 
01327         dev = mop->mo_device;
01328         if (mop->mo_flags & MO_IS_LOOP)
01329                 dev = mop->mo_loopdev;
01330 
01331         /* Quota feature is already enabled? */
01332         if (is_feature_enabled("quota", dev)) {
01333                 vprint("Quota feature is already enabled.\n");
01334                 return 0;
01335         }
01336 
01337         /* Turn on quota feature by "tune2fs -O quota" */
01338         snprintf(cmd, cmdsz, "%s -O quota %s", TUNE2FS, dev);
01339         ret = run_command(cmd, cmdsz);
01340         if (ret)
01341                 fprintf(stderr, "command:%s (%d)", cmd, ret);
01342 
01343         return ret;
01344 }
01345 
01346 int ldiskfs_init(void)
01347 {
01348         /* Required because full path to DEBUGFS is not specified */
01349         setenv("PATH", "/bin:/sbin:/usr/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/local/bin", 0);
01350 
01351         return 0;
01352 }
01353 
01354 void ldiskfs_fini(void)
01355 {
01356         return;
01357 }
